title: CTRL+Shift
short_description: Data-driven exploration of oral history interviews with 11 prominent contemporary American poets
description: CTRL+Shift is an online collection of audio and video recordings, transcripts, process visualizations, and data analyses broken out from interviews conducted with 11 prominent contemporary American poets from across the United States. The project examines recent changes in writing practices that occurred due to the advent of the computer and the arrival of the digital age and investigates new modes of working with and publishing data from qualitative interview studies. Devin Becker conducted the interviews in 2013 and 2014 as part of a University of Idaho Seed Grant award. Becker collaborated with Corey Oglesby and Lauren Westerfield (both MFA candidates at the University of Idaho in the summer of 2017) to analyze and publish the data and findings online at CTRL+Shift.org.

title: Storying Extinction
short_description: Multidisciplinary, "deep map" essaying of the extirpation of North Idaho's Caribou population
description: Storying Extinction is a multidisciplinary digital humanities project aimed at representing community response to the recent extirpation (2019) of mountain caribou from the South Selkirk mountains of North Idahoâ€”the last caribou to inhabit the coterminous United States.

title: CollectionBuilder
director: Evan Williamson; Devin Becker; Olivia Wikle
all_people: Evan Williamson; Devin Becker; Olivia Wikle;Jylisa Doney
short_description: Open source frameworks for creating digital collection and exhibit websites that are driven by metadata and powered by modern static web technology
description: CollectionBuilder is an open source tool for creating digital collection and exhibit websites that are driven by metadata and powered by modern static web technology.

title: Vandal Poem of the Day
all_people: Devin Becker; Alexandra Teague;Corey Oglesby; Cady Favazzo
short_description: Public poetry project featuring prominent poetry publishers from across the US.
description: Vandal Poem of the Day (VPOD) is a public poetry project, which brings relevant contemporary poetry to the University of Idaho and the broader Idaho community. A new poem is published on this website every day during the academic year. So far VPOD has featured 5 preses and one journal, including the journal Poetry Northwest and the presses Copper Canyon, BOA Editions, Persea Books, Canarium Books, and Flood Editions.

title: Oral History as Data (OHD)
short_description: Oral history and qualitative interview publication and analysis framework.
description: Oral History as Data is a static web tool that allows you to publish and analyze oral histories and/or qualitative interviews online for free using GitHub Pages and Jekyll. The tool serves as technical undergirding for the CTRL+Shift and Voices of Gay Rodeo websites. The site and the GitHub Repository generating it can be used as a template for producing your own digital collection of searchable and visualized transcripts.
